N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 179.2 - Amount of operating aid to councils

State Regulations

The commissioner shall make a specific allocation of funds
to each council. The amount of operating aid to each council shall not exceed
the actual expenditures by each council for approved operating purposes as
reported in the last available annual audit. Funds shall be apportioned to each
council within the limitation set forth above and the limit of the
appropriation therefor, and in accordance with the following: (a) Allocation. The allocation to each
council shall be based upon: (1)
five-year
historical funding percentages; (2)
consideration of need as a result of changing technology or the provision of
new services; and
(3)
emergencies
or other exceptional circumstances affecting basic transmission or studio
operations and/or State or Federal requirements. (b) Consolidation. (1)

In the event the consolidation of two or
more councils results in a single council serving the entire metropolitan New

York City area and Long Island with broadcast service, it shall receive no more
than 55 percent of the total monies available for public television in the
first full year of operations; no more than 53 percent of the total monies
available for public television in the second year of operations; and no more
than 50 percent of the total monies available for public television in the
third year of operations. Each year thereafter, that council shall receive no
more than 50 percent of the total monies available for public
television. (2)

In the event that
two or more councils shall consolidate into one council in a manner other than
paragraph (1) of this subdivision pursuant to an order of consolidation granted
by the Board of Regents, during the fiscal year in which such consolidation
occurs, the consolidated council shall receive the sum of the full amount that
each constituent council was apportioned at the start of such fiscal year. In
subsequent years, the historical funding percentages of both councils shall be
considered as well as the provisions of paragraph (1) of this subdivision in
the determination of the council's allocation. Notes
